website_summaries.verdict: An amplified model that reaches up to 50 miles, especially when placed close to windows.
pros: Clear Circuit technology provides vivid picture quality
cons: Extra-long 18-ft. cable may be too much for some users and can be awkward if the extra length is not needed

customer_reviews.title: THIS ANTENNA DOES NOT WORK. Zeros stars.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this 50-mile amplified useless square of plastic from a review (I suspect was paid for) to replace a much older 30-mile flat digital TV antenna expecting it would be a better picture and pull in more channels. The old one receives 41 channels, so I put this in the exact same spot, connected the USB amp power line, and got NOTHING. That's right, not one single DTV channel! My TV is a 2019 Samsung 4K QLED 60, in case you're wondering. So, I reconnected the old flat antenna, made by 1 By One, scanned yet again, then I had the 41 DTV channels again. Caveat emptor.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Fribush

customer_reviews.title: Does not pick up many channels
customer_reviews.text: The ad says you can pick up many clear stations. I live 30 miles from Boston and got one very clear channel; and 4 or 5 others that were not clear at all. Most of the stations I never heard of. Maybe okay if you live in the city.
customer_reviews.author: BVG

customer_reviews.title: An effective indoor antenna
customer_reviews.text: This antenna picks up about 50% more stations (44 broadcast stations) than our previous (unpowered) indoor antenna. There is also less dropout, though this is somewhat dependent on the positioning of the antenna. We do live in a metropolitan area, so there are transmitters in the vicinity. (See photo - Winegard FlatWave antenna is the bright white rectangle leaning against the wall behind the TV.)
customer_reviews.author: DeltaNine

customer_reviews.title: Not fit for purpose.
customer_reviews.text: I have cut the cable cord. I wanted an antenna that would pick up PBS. Any thing else it might pick up is irrelevant. It picks up CW, NBC and My N only. The Winegard range guide that I reviewed prior to buying was grossly inaccurate about the available signals available to me. Recommend that anyone who is contemplating these antenna verify the signals that are available to them from an independent source. The Winegard help line was simply ill-informed.
customer_reviews.author: Susan G

customer_reviews.title: The best quality flat antenna!
customer_reviews.text: Compared to some of the bigger named units, this flat, indoor antenna is worth paying a premium for. It gets MUCH better reception, especially when paired with their amplifier. It's not as simple and elegant of a solution with their own amplifier, but it just plain works and gets reception that other units rated with a longer range just won't get.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas & Jessii

customer_reviews.title: Excellent range
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this antenna and the other highly reviewed antenna on amazon sold by 1byone so I could compare them. Turned out to be a good decision since this antenna was far superior - it detected 155 channels compared to just 18 channels detected by 1byone (review left for that product as well). Winegard antenna has a larger surface area and the coax cable that comes with it is also much longer than provided by 1byone, which allows more convenient antenna placement. My TV towers are 12 and 20 miles away and this antenna captured all the available channels. Yet another example where the most popular Amazon product is not in fact the highest quality product.
customer_reviews.author: Emil

customer_reviews.title: Winegard FL5500A FlatWave
customer_reviews.text: This was bought to replace another brand that had been working fine up until recently. I don't know if it's the redistribution of channel signals that's been occurring or possible degradation of the antenna, but the pictures were getting more pixelated and/or dropping out completely, so I decided to try this due to online recommendations. I placed this antenna in the same place as the old one and after scanning for channels, noticed a decided improvement. However, a few weeks since the original setup, there has been some "rain fade" with several of the weaker channels and even one that's usually a strong signal.
customer_reviews.author: John_in_NC

customer_reviews.title: this works
customer_reviews.text: I bought this from Amazon warehouse for half the price list price because I was not sure I could get reception in my camper. I was surprised! I found over 10 HD channels at three different camp locations. I had TV reception but no cell phone reception. If you move your camper or have poor signal, run the channel search on your TV again. One very stormy night caused the picture quality to diminish. Running channel search again improved my picture quality.
customer_reviews.author: N

customer_reviews.title: we followed the suggestion that this antenna was the best and by doing so
customer_reviews.text: The "no signal" keeps popping up every time something in the picture makes a loud noise or whatever! We expected all of the local channels, and we are only getting 2 & 7, with some lousy movie channel. We are wasting a lot of time moving the antenna from here to there which is becoming very frustrating. Just think, we followed the suggestion that this antenna was the best and by doing so, we CANCELLED our cable. However, this made us realize that we can get a LOT of MORE IMPORTANT THINGS DONE WITHOUT TV. We have sixty (60) days to return the mess. If time permits, we will do just that. Signed: A VERY DISAPPOINTED CUSTOMER
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup, 4k broadcast, 46 new FREE channels. Whoo-hah!
customer_reviews.text: Make sure you download the (free) phone app first. It's easy to use. As you look 360 degrees around the TV room though your camera, the local station (icons) are superimposed over what you see (see image, like star apps.). I never would have thought to put the antenna that far from TV, but that direction found for me 46 digital channels. ++Way cool.+++ The antenna cord was long enough (18.5 ft) to get to correct window, too. Really like that it is designed and made in USA.
customer_reviews.author: Picky Designer Guy

customer_reviews.title: Works great despite living in low elevation
customer_reviews.text: I live in the first floor of a house with some obstruction with trees. I first purchased a different brand of antenna that was not amplified. I was not able to receive all the major channels (in particular ABC and CBS). This antenna was able to receive all the major channels (ABC, CBS, NBC, Fox, PBS) and all other channels within range.
customer_reviews.author: J. Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Does exactly what I wanted.
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to install, and really draws in the stations. I have it inside my house, not in a window, just sitting on top of my TV cabinet. I wasn't expecting much in that location, but the number of channels it's pulling in is fantastic. Obviously, signal strength depends on a lot of factors. I went out to TVfool for it's evaluation of reception potential in our area, and this antenna is bringing in everything TVfool said we could get with an indoor setup. I'm sure the amplification feature helps a lot. For the price difference, don't bother with anything that isn't amped.
customer_reviews.author: usually analytical

customer_reviews.title: Trees definitely impact reception
customer_reviews.text: I read reviews of indoor antennas and settled on this one. I researched signal strength from stations and they show that I should have a strong signal from all stations. Unfortunately, we have a lot of trees in our neighborhood. After moving the antenna round to numerous locations in our house we have started finding channels. I had originally posted a terrible review, but since I have found channels I needed to be fair and change my review. The lesson is to be patient and to try and try again until you find channels.
customer_reviews.author: Sala C

customer_reviews.title: Best indoor tv antenna available
customer_reviews.text: I have bought from Amazon three of the highest rated indoor tv antennas listed and the Winegard FL5500A is by far the best. It is best made and gets much better reception. The [2020 Version] TV Antenna,ANTOP Super Thin HDTV Digital Indoor Antenna was poor as was the [2020 Latest] Amplified HD Digital TV Antenna. Note: the 360 reception for all indoor tv antennas is truly fake. The antenna needs to be facing the broadcast towers. (unless you live a few miles from them) ALWAYS check your areas tv broadcast towers direction. The Winegard is the most expensive, but I got it Used-Like New and it has been great. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: P. Noga

customer_reviews.title: Great reception for VHF as well as UHF channels!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this hoping it could improve on a different indoor antenna that wasn't reliably picking up VHF channels (notably the Fox and ABC affiliates). We're in LA metro, the Mt Wilson transmitters are about 20 miles away. I swapped the Winegard antenna in for the old antenna and straight out of the box it picked up the Fox affiliate just fine - I didn't even have to pick up the antenna and hunt around for a signal! It also picks up ABC and all the channels the old antenna did. Happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: waste of time and money do not buy
customer_reviews.text: this is a piece of junk no matter where I put it in my house I get zero channels. I tried near the tv, near the outside walls, placed in a window, placed on the ceiling nope nothing. After spending a good two hours of trying different options I gave up. Do not waste your time or money on this junk.
customer_reviews.author: Dale A. Reifert

customer_reviews.title: Gotta have VHF/UHF
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace my older Winegard antenna which was no longer picking up the local NBC channel. I originally replaced with a less expensive antenna not realizing I needed one with VHF/UHF frequency. When the new antenna didn't pick up the NBC channel I goggled the problem. The on line tech information recommended various Winegard antennas with VHF/UHF frequency. I returned the replacement antenna and purchased the new Winegard. I can once again get NBC. My original Winegard was maybe 4 years old and work great until recently. I think this new one has updated technology.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works well but does not tolerate sunlight well
customer_reviews.text: It’s easy to connect, the picture quality is very good, and it finds all the network channels consistently. I tested it in several locations before settling on a window. The down side is that within the first two weeks, the top third of the antenna completely curled over, presumably from the heat. That is why I gave it 3 stars instead of 4. So far, that hasn’t seemed to interfere with how it works, but time will tell.
customer_reviews.author: C

customer_reviews.title: It worked great!
customer_reviews.text: In process of cord cutting with SlingTV and needed to add local channels. Installed antenna in the shelving containing my electronic components about 5' high with brick outside wall. Hooked it up and 24 channels came through with quality as good as my cable on these local stations. Only use it for five major network stations...not selecting all of the "odd" stations. Hooked it to SLingTV's AirTV which integrated it into it's menus and guides and broadcast the channels to the other 4 tv's in the house.
customer_reviews.author: KA Joyce

customer_reviews.title: Do not be afraid to change
customer_reviews.text: I turned off Direct TV along with Cox Cable and Hughes I was tired of having to call monthly and hours of calling to get the prices down then they turn around and raise it again. I have apps that I can see anything I want that I usually saw on the others. I have had no issues and I have three TVs. I wish I had done this sooner.
customer_reviews.author: lynne

customer_reviews.title: so simple
customer_reviews.text: plugged it in, scanned for channels...boom...free tv! we moved it all around the room for a week or two before command stripping it to the back of a bookshelf next to the tv. it's not even by a window and I still got perfect reception! very pleased with how tiny it is compared to the monster units they had a few years ago when digital antenna first came out. pretty cool!
customer_reviews.author: abc mom

customer_reviews.title: Easy set up, more available channels than my other antenna
customer_reviews.text: This antenna pulls in 30% more channels than my old Trek indoor antenna. I did a channel scan with the old antenna and could just pull in 51 channels, with this new antenna I get 70 channels, several 50+ miles away! I suggest using the free FCC online DTV Reception Map to determine where your nearby TV towers are located so you can orient your antenna the best way.
customer_reviews.author: M Simpson

customer_reviews.title: I Live in the coutry, and get 20 Channels...
customer_reviews.text: Have tried several indoor antennas (Clear Stream among them-Got 4 Channels only if weather was good). With this Winegard I am receiving 20+ Channels. I am 56 miles from the television towers. I get NBC (plus it's 4 affiliates), CBS (plus it's 3 affiliates), Fox Television, Bounce, Grit, ION, PBS plus several more. Just can't get ABC, but I can watch those shows with an App on my firestick. Just ordered another one for my Aunt. Cable has just gotten so expensive and here in Oklahoma we need good Television for weather alerts and radar during Storm season! Thank You Winegard!!!
customer_reviews.author: Marea Tigert

customer_reviews.title: not good enough
customer_reviews.text: I am about 20 to 30 miles form NYC and this brought in about 38 stations, with about 12 being Spanish. It garbled the reception of WPIX and couldn't get the NY PBS station at all. An un amplified one did a bit better but neither is good enough unless you are really trying to save or are going to use this for a rarely used TV. I have a slightly more expensive antenna on the floor of my attic and it gets better reception then this one at the window. It is higher up, but not in a place with any window at all.
customer_reviews.author: TCTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: A fantastic antenna. The absolute best I have ever tried.
customer_reviews.text: Straight to the point: I'm finally able to get all the channels I knew I could get! A fantastic antenna that delivers what it promises. After getting frustrated with several other antennas, I decided to try this one. It took some time to position it the right way, but once you get it, the signal is strong and stable. It's very thin and larger than other models (Which I guess also helps with the reception). As an added bonus, I was able to curve it a bit for improved reception. Couldn't be happier!
customer_reviews.author: Patrix

customer_reviews.title: Try several positions!
customer_reviews.text: The only thing I have against this is that it only comes with two adhesive hangers. You can easily get more, but I had to move it several times to get the best reception. Some hints; go to the website listed in the instructions to see where the broadcast towers are around you, then hang the antenna with the flat black side facing that direction. Best bet is to hang it on a window, just make sure there is no metal screen! Seems to work pretty well for us, and we're in a bit of a valley. Again, move it around, try several locations/directions, and scan for channels (about 3 minutes) EACH time you reposition it.
customer_reviews.author: OldSaltCityAce

customer_reviews.title: Vast improvement
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't believe that this is such an improvement over my last one. It has a focusing app for your phone that allows you to find the optimal placement for your antenna, self-attachments for the wall (something like velcro), and long enough cords to place it where your want/need it to be. Good job, peeps!
customer_reviews.author: Linda Porter

customer_reviews.title: More than double the channels
customer_reviews.text: With my old digital antenna I barely got 32 channels and those channels came and went. With this new digital antenna I get 86 channels all of them with very strong consistent signals. This was a top rated choice in Consumer Reports Magazine and it was the perfect decision for me. This antenna is Amplified. Its coax cable is longer than most. Like most indoor digital antennas it seems to be a little bit flimsy but that's just normal and not negative for this particular antenna. I would highly recommend this antenna to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Jogger

customer_reviews.title: Best Overall Indoor Antenna
customer_reviews.text: I’ve tried about 5 hd antennas now and I think this is probably the overall best one. I was able to pick up the most channels at the best reception with this antenna. I live in a rural area and was still able to pick up about 8 channels with no interference. You will experience some break up in heavy rain though but that cannot be avoided with any antenna. The design is nice and sleek too, it is paper thin with a pretty lengthy cable. Overall I think this is the best choice for indoor hd antennas. Note this antenna with only work with hd televisions.
customer_reviews.author: Dil

customer_reviews.title: Great OTA antenna!!
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic antenna for OTA channels. I had to upgrade from a really cheap antenna to this one after reading a few recommendations on ones that offered VHF and UHF. No complaints here as all of the changes I expected now show up (a few require some adjustments as I installed it fully indoors). It's great!
customer_reviews.author: Nick S

customer_reviews.title: Ease of install and number of channels
customer_reviews.text: After much research we decided the Winegard FL5500A was the one for us. It was very easy to install. Very clear instructions. We placed this indoor antenna in a window. The number of channels we receive is amazing!! Such clear reception. Currently, we get over 120 channels (west side of Houston). We purchased a second Winegard FL5500A for our guest bedroom and are extremely satisfied with this product. We would definitely recommend this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Joni

customer_reviews.title: Buy yourself a $20 antenna instead it'll work the same
customer_reviews.text: Would I ever get this product again no the problem is it does not give you best quality picture if you have too much noise around your area it keeps going in and out I brought this product because it has the best reviews it was one other one that I decided not to get that was supposed to be better than this but I read the the reviews of that one and that was it as great as this one so at the end of the day do not spend top dollars for these antennas find you a $20 antenna it'll work just as great as the 50 and $60 antenna
customer_reviews.author: Vernon

customer_reviews.title: Very Pleased
customer_reviews.text: I live in a North Dallas suburb, and was skeptical that the Winegard FlatWave could receive WFAA Channel 8, which is VHF high band. Boy, was I pleasantly surprised. I have it taped to a South facing window, and it works (all the local network channels and a ton I never knew existed). Seems flimsy but then again, now that YouTube TV went up to $50 plus tax, this will pay for itself in one month, and if it fails after the 1 year warranty, I cannot be too upset. All the other antennas I've every tried in my house never picked up Channel 8--this one's a keeper.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Works great in our townhouse. Way less signal drop than the Clearstream I was using (especially when the wind starts blowing the tree branches around) and I’m able to get more channels. Will probably get more of these for the other TVs in the house.
customer_reviews.author: Kris A

customer_reviews.title: Works well, picks up more stations
customer_reviews.text: Works well, picks up more stations. Picks up way more than unamplified. The picture is great. Cable uses compressed signal. This receives uncompressed HD transmitted signal. I have several TV's connected thru splitters and all work great. As long as your TV has a coaxial cable connection this hooks up directly. If yours only has HDMI, you need a converter box. Pays for itself in a few months.
customer_reviews.author: Leo P.

customer_reviews.title: Great to get over the air TV
customer_reviews.text: Had to have my dish removed from the roof when getting the roof replaced. This was a great alternative for that week I was without my premium television. I would highly recommend this to anyone who is looking for an alternative.
customer_reviews.author: Nan C

customer_reviews.title: Winegard Well-Received
customer_reviews.text: To be honest, I was skeptical about the Winegard antenna. Over the years I have bought several, and they all have fallen short of the performance I sought. So when I installed the Winegard FlatWave Amplified Antenna I was surprised by how well it worked. It found 50+ channels, and all had good pictures. The television I am using is smallish, and I do not know how well it works with a large screen TV, but it works well in my application. I recommend it highly.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Evidently I live close to transmitters
customer_reviews.text: I am able to mount this right behind my tv. Picture is very good. Channels available exceed my expectations. We cut the cord a couple of years ago, and started streaming Directv Now, now ATT Now. Well, we just went one step further. We we started watching more Netflix, and Amazon Prime. The antenna cost one month of service. We do however, plan to add back HBO in a month or so. Great Product.
customer_reviews.author: K. Kadzielawski

customer_reviews.title: Better picture than cable
customer_reviews.text: I get all the major networks, PBS, and CW. I keep it limited to about 8 stations, although if I wanted I could have about 50. I don't want all that riff-raff in my list. So with my antenna(s), Hulu, Prime, Netflix, and occasional subscriptions to Sundance and Starz for bingeing certain programs, I save a huge amount, and have access to more programming than I could ever watch.
customer_reviews.author: Lazell

customer_reviews.title: Glad i purchased this
customer_reviews.text: I hardly watch tv so I decided not to pay for cable in my new home. I tried Sling TV but it wouldnt let me catch my local channels (I moved to Joliet from Chicago). I bought a digital antenna but apparently they were 10 miles out of range from broadcast towers. I read some decent reviews about this one and decided to give it a try. Glad to say I got to watch my White Sox win last night plus got to catch some local news. Great investment. If you dont wanna pay for cable, nthis is the way to go.
customer_reviews.author: Rafael Nava Jr

customer_reviews.title: WONDERFUL INSIDE ANTENNA!
customer_reviews.text: This small antenna has made a world of difference for us! Bought this for my husband when we wanted to ditch our annoying cable company who kept raising prices and reducing channels! We now have MANY more channels (at no cost) and save the money we used to spend on cable for several streaming channels but spend less for three streaming services than we did for cable!). My husband and I are absolutely delighted with our purchase and our decision to leave cable! BTW - this antennas pulls in channels 20 - 30 FARTHER away than THEY estimate! Highly recommend this wonderful product!!!! BTW - Be sure to follow their instructions on placement of this antenna; it makes a difference.
customer_reviews.author: lecpo

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!!!
customer_reviews.text: AMAZING!!! Oh my goodness! This antenna works so well! I am shocked! I am within a few miles of the CBS tower - so I expected to get that channel no problem. However, I am at least 50 miles from the ABC tower and 60 miles from the NBC tower and I have perfect reception! This thing is amazing! The picture is coming in full HD!
customer_reviews.author: C McKinnis

customer_reviews.title: Dish Network would not give me all of the channels I paid for.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because Dish Network would not give me all of the local channels that I was paying for. This antenna sits in my front window about 6' from the TV. I get a lot of local channels and picture is good at all times. When it rains I still get a good signal, unlike Dish Network. Great antenna
customer_reviews.author: Arthur Putman

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install and get operational but too much static for me
customer_reviews.text: Honestly, not sure if just my area or what but it installs absolutely fine and does bring in signal however, signals and display are static ridden and this ended up not being worth my time in my area. Yes, I did check online first and figure out coverage for the old antennae type signals. It said that I should be able to bring in 11 channels which included all the majors in my area, NBC, CBS, ABC, etc. it did capture them, it just doesn't transmit them clearly for display on my Samsung Smart TV. I was hoping to remove Cable but this particular item didn't work well enough for me.
customer_reviews.author: J Grif

customer_reviews.title: Try something else.
customer_reviews.text: The 50 mile range seems grossly exaggerated. Tried it in window as well as outside on a short wooden pole (turned it slowly 360 degrees, no help). Booster with USB was plugged in, as per directions. Would not bring in the Fox TV channel in Long Beach, Ca. (Los Angeles area) I checked a TV tower map which showed transmitter was approx 25 miles away. Disappointed. Do not try this model.
customer_reviews.author: bukzin

customer_reviews.title: Great antenna that has a built in amplifier
customer_reviews.text: This antenna is worth the buy. It has a built in amplifier that allows channels to come through clear and you are able to receive even more channels on the analog tv that cannot be seen with a plain antenna. One of my best buys, love it.
customer_reviews.author: Berdenia

customer_reviews.title: Better than the average antennas but not perfect.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this HD amplified antenna because I was not getting the best reception on a previous one that I was using. Mostly, we were having problems with ABC in a north-facing room in Boynton Beach, FL. The picture is fairly sharp but once in a while the picture would disappear. I'm mainly interested in the Major Networks, CBS, NBC, and ABC, in a temporary holiday residence for only 2-3 months a year. Still and all...I didn't have to pay for cable from Comcast.
customer_reviews.author: HL L.I.NY.Top Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: So happy cutting the cable!
customer_reviews.text: I get all the major networks plus several of the local channels and a couple of really interesting channels: The Buzzr Network which only shows vintage game shows, some as old as the early 50's! Fascinating to see how people have changed and how game shows have changed over the years. The other is Decades which is a network that focused on historical events one decade at a time, but the really good part is that Decades shows Laugh-In twice a day, every day, and they have the Dick Cavett show where he interviews some of the most important people of his time, an awesome, awesome show. Oh, yeah, antenna works great, easy to place, etc.
customer_reviews.author: thedanester

customer_reviews.title: At 30 miles, excellent UHF reception, no VHF channels picked up
customer_reviews.text: I use this connected to a Samsung Series 7 TV. Channels detected using the TV's scanning feature. Excellent reception on my ~30 mile distant NY UHF channels 2, 4, 5, 9. Poor reception on 50+ mile distant Philly UHF channel 10. VHF channels are not received well enough by this product for my TV's scanner to recognize them at all -- no channels 7 or 11 from NYC.
customer_reviews.author: ML Tross

customer_reviews.title: Actually made reception worse.
customer_reviews.text: For a over a year we have fought reception. Depending on where the antenna was situated, the weather etc etc would decide what 60% of the channels we wouldn't receive and what 40% we would receive intermittently. On a whim we plugged in a mini plain non amplified 4 inch high portable rabbit ear antenna used with aver-media products. Finally we received all channels without a problem. All are reception problems where from this antenna. It was worse at receiving channels than a wire and piece of aluminum foil.
customer_reviews.author: Glenda

customer_reviews.title: Worked great, but try different positions
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 96 years old mother-in-law, hooked it up and immediately found 15 channels. Moved it closer to a wall and got 38 channels, including PBS that didn't come in the first time! And really sharp pictures! She is delighted (and I'm her hero).
customer_reviews.author: Steve Manire

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly very good
customer_reviews.text: I've not had an indoor antenna for years and from what I remember they were not very good. This is very easy to setup and I only had to test it in about 3 different locations to find the optimal one. Picture and sound quality are good and it's great to have something to watch when every I have a sports blackout or lost internet.
customer_reviews.author: J. DFW

customer_reviews.title: Set It & Enjoy!
customer_reviews.text: Having moved from one rural home that had a large and expensive outdoor antenna (70+ mile range) to another home (just 10 miles away) with no antenna, I decided to try the Winegard FL5500A. Very surprised and happy to find that it worked just as well as the previous antenna. Setting it up was extremely quick and easy. Had the same channels we previously had with no aggravation. Just hang from a window , scan your channels, and enjoy. Would definitely recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Josephine Williams

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm....
customer_reviews.text: I am pulling in a very clear, over the air, HD picture from towers 30 miles away. (Flat terrain, but I am in a rural area.) I am now getting channels from the market I want to pull from, not the market the Feds require because of my zip code. No more local channel fees from satelite tv. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel M

customer_reviews.title: Love it !
customer_reviews.text: Cancelled Cable !! I use my Amazon Fire Stick, and this to just pay for Internet now. It was really easy to adhere to wall and we moved to another location and it adhered there just as well , without extra assistance. If placed in window we received 40 channels (news, Patriots Games...most important, and to our surprise oldies channels from the 70 & 80's (not old but might be for readers of this). We did not like reaching it that far and so placed behind TV area we get 30 channels. It does get glitchy at times, but lasts only seconds.
customer_reviews.author: Mindy L.

customer_reviews.title: Poor Reception
customer_reviews.text: I bought this based on the reviews, but once I installed it I was sadly disappointed. I live 17 miles outside of Portland and you would think I could at least get ABC, CBS, NBC and Fox. But no matter where I displayed the antenna I could only get but a few channels. Not only did I take this antenna down, but I installed an outside antenna to resolve my issues. I do not recommend this antenna unless you live very close or in a hi-rise apartment?
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Saying goodbye to hefty cable
customer_reviews.text: Serves its purpose! We mostly watch tv through the firestick and Amazon prime. We were very tired of paying the huge Comcast cable bill just to basically watch news occasionally and mostly the fall/winter sports we enjoy. When we heard that prime and possibly Hulu were going to be carrying hockey, SEC and other sports shows we watch, we decided to ditch cable in hopes of this promise. We get 18 channels and have had no trouble whatsoever with bad reception. Clear picture all the time. Now we hope Amazon comes through with its promises.
customer_reviews.author: Just a regular person

customer_reviews.title: What a difference!
customer_reviews.text: We had a small box antenna for years and could retrieve 3-5 channels, weather depending. This was by far easier to hook up and use immediately. We went from 2 dependable channels to 23. Being in a very hilly, rural area we were really hoping this would solve our reception issues. So far so good. We loved the USB/charging capability and the longer cord allows for more accessibility. Before we were limited by a short cord and easily broken, rotating antennas on a small box. The thin construction makes for a clutter free TV stand and less unsightly cords.
customer_reviews.author: Ang B

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I have no regrets buying this antenna. It was very easy to install and I have all the local channels and other channels numbering about 50 in total. It doesn't hurt that all the 5 local channels show college football and one shows NFL games. I am very satisfied with this antenna.
customer_reviews.author: RICHARD ANSAH

customer_reviews.title: So Far So Good - High in the Mountains - and 11 Channels to date...
customer_reviews.text: I'm smart - but not too techie. Even I could install one end....ANT IN on back of TV ....and attach the Antenna to a nearby area that looks right out a window towards town Antenna's on the mountainside. I'm high in the mountains, but just outside town. I was sceptical...but happy to even get 11 channels. So Far...I plan on moving the Antenna around the room and see if I can get more. I have an "Air" question vs. "DTV Air" ...I'll ask in the Questions area.
customer_reviews.author: christine-marie

customer_reviews.title: Not the FlatWave Amped Digital Indoor Antenna's Fault.
customer_reviews.text: Bought a Indoor antenna because of problems with the TV signal from the transmission source. "Cut the Cable". Re-transmitted cable was being manipulated. The network transmissions sites were too far for the antenna to pic it up, and amplify enough for a good TV signal. Am shopping for a longer range antenna. I just live too far from the transmission site and the reliability therefore suffers.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Results with This Antenna
customer_reviews.text: I live in Fort Wayne, IN, about 15 miles from the transmitter towers and when I installed this antenna and did a scan, I found I got 24 strong channels. I was amazed! I have the antenna connected to my 4-tuner Tablo OTA recorder and can view any of the channels on any of my four TVs that are on my WiFi or wired home network. I've not had any problems since I installed the antenna in July 2018.
customer_reviews.author: William F. Blue

customer_reviews.title: Great Value and Performance
customer_reviews.text: After 35 years of cable TV, we decided to cut the cord. We researched antennas, and this Winegard was among the most highly rated, and rightfully so. It took a bit of experimenting to get the best reception, but now I can't tell the difference between the reception with the Winegard and cable. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: MitchV

customer_reviews.title: It does not work
customer_reviews.text: It picks up nothing, Nada, zip. No channels at all. I have moved it to at least 10 separate locations trying to get anything, and there are no channels at all. I bought this because I wanted something better quality, and I thought a higher price would correlate with quality. My mistake.
customer_reviews.author: MichiganLady312

customer_reviews.title: A GREAT substitute for cable!!!  Cutting the cord was a pleasure with this antenna deal!!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install - easy to use!!! And there are program guides on the internet to go with it. And - if you must - get ROKU to help ease the transition. Together they are better!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Francene M Williams

customer_reviews.title: Amplified Antenna
customer_reviews.text: Was not totally impressed with reception. Believe you could get the same reception with other antennas at lesser cost. We mounted the antenna high in the room near the ceiling which helped a lot. Thought amplification would be beneficial but did not see the difference from a lower cost non-amplified RCA antenna. Would assume if we could mount the antenna higher the reception may improve. So we think the antenna is over-priced for the difference expected, which is only slight. It did get more info-commercial stations at the higher end but that isn't what we were looking to receive.
customer_reviews.author: Zippy1643

customer_reviews.title: Works great, I'm in the Chicago area and it does ...
customer_reviews.text: Works great, I'm in the Chicago area and it does get the elusive CBS channel, but not on channel 2, it's on 48.3 approximately, or is it 43.8, regardless, it is still the wbbm chicago station. We cut the cable and between this, direct tv now,and an amazon fire stick with kodi on it, I am saving $88/month... so long Comcast!!
customer_reviews.author: jja

customer_reviews.title: Good antenna, but does NOT get VHF
customer_reviews.text: Check with your local stations. We bought this because it received UHF and VHF. We only have one VHF station in the Cinci area and we are unable to get it. Every other station is UHF and comes in clearly. Tried different locations, etc. and still unable to receive that one channel. Would have given five stars if it worked with the VHF too.
customer_reviews.author: L. Ellison

customer_reviews.title: Much better than expected
customer_reviews.text: I have tried 4 different antennas with different degrees of success. So, when I took this one out of the box my expectations were mixed. I hooked it up and positioned it towards the best coverage and was surprised to see that it picked up more than any of the other (more expensive) antennas. This includes the local NBC affiliate which is on VHF. As everyone should note reception and antennas depend on location and positioning (also weather and sun activity). I recommend reading the directions and looking at the website before purchasing any antenna - the more you know about the signal the better selection you will make.
customer_reviews.author: Don

customer_reviews.title: Consider the distance
customer_reviews.text: Make sure you know that this one sticks to a window and needs a plug in. This one does not have a pre-amp either, so don't buy this if you live more than 20 miles from your nearest tower. This model does not amplify your signal. I want to return this for the Winegard I could put in my attic with a 60 mile range, but I can't return it. I am debating what to do.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas Daninger

customer_reviews.title: Works great in central Florida!
customer_reviews.text: We cut the cable cord this year and this little device is wonderful! We get local channels- about 40 of them, with local cbs, NBC and fox. I was concerned at first because our TV is set up in our family room is across a window, not next to it so I thought it would have signal issues. None at all have been experienced by putting this on the wall behind the TV. Works wonderfully! Image is super clear and crisp more so than with cable. With this, and streaming options like PS VUE, Amazon prime etc, we are saving over $70 a month! Happy camper!
customer_reviews.author: kscribe

customer_reviews.title: Great picture quality if you have the patience to find the "sweet spot"
customer_reviews.text: Placed the antenna in several spots around the house. Got a few channels, and the ones that came in with a solid signal had great picture quality. Couldn't find a spot that picked up all of the channels my rabbit ears did, though. And some of the channels couldn't locate a strong signal, so there was a lot of interference on those particular channels. Willing to admit that I could've given it more time and tried moving the antenna around more, but I don't have the patience for it.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron J. Quixote

customer_reviews.title: works just like rabbit ears for all you older folks
customer_reviews.text: works just like rabbit ears for all you older folks :-) when the signal comes in - it comes in VERY good. The picture you see over the airwaves is better than what you get from cable. But, just like rabbit ears, the signal can come and go, you have to find the right spot for the antenna, etc. Not sure it's really the fault of the antenna, it's just part of broadcast signals over the air.
customer_reviews.author: dbake

customer_reviews.title: Works well!
customer_reviews.text: This antenna was easy to install and is performing well. I live near Washington DC and about 35 miles south of Baltimore. The channel scan found all of the major channels from both areas. The reception is clear in good weather, with some slight pixelation on the Baltimore channels during rain. The antenna is on the second floor of the house. I first placed it in a window thinking the reception might be better, but when I closed the aluminum miniblinds (behind the antenna) the signal disappeared. I moved the antenna to the side of a clothes chest and reception was very good as described above. So for local channels, this seems an excellent alternative to cable.
customer_reviews.author: Arctic John

customer_reviews.title: Cable cutting, cash savings!!!
customer_reviews.text: These antennas gave us the inspiration to "cut the cable" cord! After reading the reviews, we purchased one for each of our TVs (3). We were pleasantly surprised to receive 45 HD QUALITY channels within our 50 mile range! AWESOME!!! Much better than we even we ever had with cable! We then added a Roku (one time purchase cost of $70 or so) and then "Sling TV" ($20 per month) to allow us to receive CNN, HGTV, movies, listen to Pandora etc etc. PERFECT!! We now pay monthly charge of $70 instead of $140 for Internet and TV, a savings of $840/ year!!!
customer_reviews.author: Happy Feet

customer_reviews.title: Finally some channels!
customer_reviews.text: We had been using RCA rabbit ears style antenna from Walmart, we got 4 channels but they kept cutting in and out. Messing with rabbit ears is so frustrating. Bought this Winegard Flat Wave and when installed in a window, we now get 14 channels coming in crystal clear! The first time we scanned for channels it said 4 were found, the second time it said 14 channels! Awesome. Worth every penny. We did not get the amplified one, but this one works great! We live in town but never had luck with other antenna's until this one.
customer_reviews.author: Gypsy77

customer_reviews.title: Great product and very good low price.
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these for my neighbor because I have one in my own house and gets used everyday. A very good product and worth every penny. Don't buy others-this company knows what they are doing. Follow the instructions and yours should last as long as your house. Thanks.
customer_reviews.author: sg7365

customer_reviews.title: This might work well for stations that are close to you (10 miles or less) otherwise save your money and buy a better product if
customer_reviews.text: Supposed to have a 50 mile range. I live in the Central Valley in California. Nothing but flat land out here. According to the antenna website, I have several stations that are about 30 miles away. It didn't pick up a single station. Not one. I of course re-connected everything, tried multiple positions with the antenna, and sought support with no luck. It's a bummer as this is rated well online, and I'm cutting the cord from cable. This might work well for stations that are close to you (10 miles or less) otherwise save your money and buy a better product if your far from the stations.
customer_reviews.author: jdavis_2014

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Range and Reception
customer_reviews.text: Bought this antenna for my father-in-law as he lives fairly distant from some of the broadcast towers in his area. This works great and brings in crystal clear reception. Be aware that you may have to play around with the placement of the antenna to find the optimum spot, however once found it performs flawlessly. The stated range is 50 miles and that is likely under the most ideal of conditions, however this is pulling in HD channels from about 32 miles away. Feel that this will last longer than some of the less expensive imported brands.
customer_reviews.author: Coyote

customer_reviews.title: Get rid of cable
customer_reviews.text: This is a great alternative to cable. We get about 35-45 channels depending on its location. We got it mostly to get the basic channels such as NBC and ABC and those work great, plus some other channels we have never heard of. We use Netflix and hulu to watch other shows and using these we don't miss cable at all. The only complaint is we live by an airport and we loose reception every time a plane flies overhead (To be expected maybe? ). This shouldn't be a problem for most people though, but because of this I give it 4 stars instead of 5. Otherwise this is a great antenna!
customer_reviews.author: EM

customer_reviews.title: Returned for refund
customer_reviews.text: Didn't work for us. Tried it on 3 different TV's (all less than 5 years old), tried it in every window, on every wall, floor, ceiling you name it we put it there. Went thru a whole pack of command stickers I had on hand. ZILCH nothing but constant NO SIGNAL after running a scan after every single move. Have had outside antennas in the past and they worked beautifully.. wanted this for a room that I didn't want to add a cable box to. Amazon made returning for refund easy !
customer_reviews.author: A. Ward

customer_reviews.title: Great, just not able to pick up PBS for some reason.
customer_reviews.text: After using the Amazon Basic 35m and only recieving 15 channels, i switched to the Winegard 50mile. Without the power adapter plugged in, the antenna picked up 22 channels (7 more than Amazon) and had a stronger signal on several channels. Witht the power adapter plugged in, i was able to pick up 31 Channels (16 more than Amazon Basic and 9 channels more than without the power adapter). The only channel i cant seem to get is PBS, for the kids. I am not sure why i can pick up channels 52 miles away, but i cant get PBS that is only 9 miles away.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Did not work
customer_reviews.text: Tried the unit on three different TV's one of which is less than a year old. None of the TV's would recognize that the antenna was installed. Used The Winegard TV tower finder App and was well with in range on numerous tower's (Area code 75036) - Dallas Metro location. The unit was purchased as used and it is possible that the original purchaser some how damaged the unit.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Miller

customer_reviews.title: Perfect cable subscription alternative
customer_reviews.text: We have a small tv in our bedroom that we generally only use to watch the morning news or late night talk shows, so we didn't want to add this tv to our cable subscription and pay a monthly fee. This took about 5 minutes to set up for start to finish, and it works perfectly! We mounted the receiver on our bedroom window (bottom floor), and despite there being several trees on that side of our home, the picture is crystal clear and we get all major cable networks. We do live in a major city, so that likely helps. I would definitely recommend this product to others.
customer_reviews.author: Laurie C

customer_reviews.title: Best deal out therr
customer_reviews.text: Works great. One time purchase and you get the channels . My smart tv accepts this.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected.
customer_reviews.text: Exceeded expectations. Brings in about 48-49 channels. After de-listing alt-language, preachers, home shopping, and channels less meaningful to us, still left with about 30-35 channels. Easy to install. Catching up on a LOT of Gilligan's Island, Hogan's Heroes, and many other 60s and 70s reruns on all the -2, -3, -4 channels. Not a shortcoming of the antenna, but REALLY, REALLY wish there were a way to see a local listing guide broadcast. That would be a great help.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Canceled my cable TV saving $88 a month. I live about 30 miles west of Houston and get 83 channels with this antenna, some are foreign language and religious. I have put 40 of those channels on my favorite list.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Great reception!
customer_reviews.text: This Winegard antenna is replacing a Mohu Leaf which seemed to be degrading in performance after 2.5 years and had also yellowed in the FL heat/sun in its window location. I am about 33 miles away from TV towers, and the terrain here is flat as a pancake with tall buildings in between, so a 50 mile amplified is a requirement. I have to say, either the Mohu Leaf had truly degraded in quality as well, or the Winegard is a totally better antenna for my location. I got a few more channels than the Mohu, for a total of 6o, and the picture quality is NOTICEABLY better. Just amazing. I am very satisfied with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: FloridaMum

customer_reviews.title: A Five-Star Experience
customer_reviews.text: Definition of a five-star experience: Saturday 10pm: Brother-in-law says he won't come over Sunday unless he can see the World Series. Problem: We don't have cable. Sunday 7am: Research all the antennas like a Talmudic scholar. Winegard LF5500A looks like the tops. Sunday 8am: Order the Winegard for Amazon same-day delivery (how do they do that?). Sunday 7pm: Winegard antenna arrives. Sunday 7:10pm: Winegard antenna installs "plug and play" with no effort at all, channel scan runs in three minutes, and we suddenly have sixty channels of cable (!). Take that, Comcast. Sunday 8pm: Brother-in-law is happy. So are we.
customer_reviews.author: Scottaleh

customer_reviews.title: Works very well
customer_reviews.text: Just hang it high enough and at the right angle. Works very well. I get a lot of stations; all the important ones. Makes me want to unplug from cable.
customer_reviews.author: D. Winger

customer_reviews.title: Clear Signals Easy To Use
customer_reviews.text: I get a nice channel listing from this product. I live on the first floor of a 3 story apartment building so I put it up as high as I can get it. I usually do a channel search once a month per the specs and it actually picked up two additional channels last time. On a really cloudy day (a lot of those in Oregon) I have some reception issues but its not this antennas fault as other channels are in crystal clarity. I really do love this thing and it is a must for cord cutters. Very easy to apply. I just used blue loctite putty to stick it on the wall and it works fine.
customer_reviews.author: xayekim

customer_reviews.title: Good antenna overall
customer_reviews.text: Maybe I don't understand this new HD over the air tv thing....but I rarely get all the channels I'm supposed to get, and I'm only 22 miles from the stations downtown. This antenna is well made but a little difficult to aim. It's nice that its flat, but if you need to aim it perpendicular to your wall, you really can't. I'm happy with it....but maybe I need to stop being cheap and spring for cable!
customer_reviews.author: Jake H.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent supplement to streaming service
customer_reviews.text: This antenna generally works great for most primary networks. I do have trouble consistently in the daytime with one network in particular, but the others seem to work fine then as well. Picture quality is actually better than streaming if using the antenna in the evenings in lieu of streaming service. Price was reasonable and it was easy to set up. I have it on the wall near windows with white side out making it less intrusive in appearance in the room.
customer_reviews.author: PriorPA

customer_reviews.title: Great antenna!
customer_reviews.text: I was kind of iffy about purchasing this, but I'm so glad I did. Works great. Super simple to set up (did end up having to place it in the window for best reception, but my curtains hide the cord). I live about 30 miles away from the towers. Am able to get all the major broadcast networks plus another 30 random channels that I've never heard of. Easy to move with the Command stickies. I picked this one based on the reviews and paid full price-no discount or freebie.
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: BEST by far.Great Reception!
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased a total of three of these Winegard antennae. They are excellent in this S.F. Bay Area. They bring in about 90 channels perfectly -- beyond Comcast and for FREE. I did experiment with a $39.99 other brand to learn the difference. Give it a try. I'm NOT being paid for this review.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon Luther

customer_reviews.title: Cable cutting doesn’t work for everyone.
customer_reviews.text: Great little antenna. It pulls in a lot of channels. It also reminds me why I went with cable in the first place. Maybe cutting the cord is a good idea in heavily populated areas like the big cities on the coasts but, out here in the badlands of New Mexico the pickings are pretty slim. What is available is antique programming. I’m tired of reruns of Brady Bunch and the Andy Griffith show.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Reader for RPi4

customer_reviews.title: Freedom from the tyranny of cable
customer_reviews.text: This thing paid for itself in one month! I got better reception in Ft Worth, TX than I do in Dallas...but I live in an apartment and can't control my access as well as I'd like. It all depends on where you live in relationship to the towers. Now I get the few channels I like plus some great old movie channels which I like better than cable! PBS and Univision were the only ones I really cared about and they come in pretty well.....it's hard to review this product though, because reception will be different for everybody. Lots of religious channels and Spanish and Vietnamese...even some Bollywood channels, wow!
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn Glenn

customer_reviews.title: Works great and gets wonderful reception to give me FREE ACCESS ...
customer_reviews.text: Works great and gets wonderful reception to give me FREE ACCESS to basic channels like CBS, ABC, NBC, FOX, etc.The channels come through clearly and in HD too. Be warned, however, that this could be because I live close to a major city with these towers not too far away. Individual experiences may vary.
customer_reviews.author: Sloane

customer_reviews.title: Indoor Antena - so easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I am 79 yrs old and this was so so easy to hook up. Plug into the TV , hook up to Tivo box and plug into line of antenna. I had a previous antenna and so I easily did the channel scan and channels cane up crisp an clear.
customer_reviews.author: M. sinatra

customer_reviews.title: Opened it up, taped it to a window reasonably ...
customer_reviews.text: Opened it up, taped it to a window reasonably facing the majority of the broadcast antennas, hooked it to the TV and plugged in the USB power supply and am pulling in between 40 and 50 channels in the San Antonio area. Actually bought another for the bedroom, although you can split these. Paired the antennas with  for PVR functions. I'm saving over $100 per month from Time Warner and haven't missed anything (I use Hulu and Amazon Prime for speciality content).
customer_reviews.author: A. HoustonTop Contributor: Photography

product_meta.title: Winegard FL5500A FlatWave Amped Digital HD Indoor Amplified TV Antenna (4K Ready / ATSC 3.0 Ready / High-VHF / UHF), 50 Mile Long Range
product_meta.description:
Style:FlatWave AmpedWinegard FL5500A FlatWave Amped Digital HD Indoor Amplified TV Antenna: 

Watch local news, weather, live sports and all of the top-rated shows for free, in HD, and with Dolby Digital Surround Sound with the FlatWave Amped indoor amplified TV antenna.

Cut the cord and save! The average home pays over $750 for cable in just one year. Did you know the average household receives 189 Tv channels with cable, but uses only 17 of them? Watch the TV you want without the big monthly TV bill. Cut the cord and watch the top-rated TV shows for free!

In The Box:
- FlatWave Amped digital indoor amplified TV antenna
- Embedded low noise digital TV antenna amplifier
- 18.5' mini coax cable attached to the TV antenna
- 3' USB power cable with 110v adapter
- Two 3M Command Brand strips

Tech Specs
- Indoor antenna range: 50 mile range
- HD dual band VHF UHF TV antenna
- Multi-directional TV antenna
- Ultra-thin, 0.6lb weight
- Amplified TV antenna dimensions: 13" x 12"

Note: Run a channel scan after installation To receive programming run a channel scan on your TV after setting up the indoor antenna. To keep your channel line-up up-to-date, it is a good idea to run a channel scan monthly and anytime a channel is lost.
feature_bullets: The FlatWave Amped is a 50 mile long range multi-directional indoor amplified TV antenna with an embedded digital TV antenna amplifier, attached mini coax cable and USB power cable with 110v adapter.

Amplified directly at the antenna elements, the amplifier is ultra-low noise with only 1dB (typical) compared to 3dB+ of noise from other antennas, giving you a crystal clear digital TV antenna signal.

Free over-the-air programming has more options and more channels than ever before. Watch local news and weather, live sports, and all the top-rated shows for free with an indoor amplified TV antenna. Pair the TV antenna with a streaming device for maximum HD programming.
Multi-directional amplified TV antenna delivers 50 mile range in both directions, giving you twice the coverage. Hang the indoor TV antenna on a window or wall, or lay the TV antenna flat on a table.
4K Ultra HD and ATSC 3.0 ready; receives both VHF and UHF signals in HD; designed and built in the U.S.A.
50 Mile Range, High Definition dual band VHF/UHF
Embedded ultra low noise (1db) digital amplifier for the best antenna performance
Includes: FlatWave Antenna with embedded low noise digital amplifier, 18.5 ft. mini 59 coaxial cable (attached to antenna), 3 ft. USB power cable with 110V adapter, Two 3M Command Brand Strips
Clear Circuit Technology: Ultra-low noise preamplifier embedded directly at the antenna elements, 1dB noise (typical), compared to 3dB+ from other preamplifiers
Multi-directional, Designed and made in the USA

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.0 out of 5 stars5,605 ratings4.0 out of 5 stars
